cricketsAndGrasshoppers

Class CricketsAndGrasshoppers

  • java.lang.Object
    • cricketsAndGrasshoppers.CricketsAndGrasshoppers

  • public class CricketsAndGrasshoppers
extends java.lang.Object
    Simulates a two-player board game where Crickets move right and Grasshoppers move left on a linear strip. Players alternate turns until one cannot move.
    Author:
    Erick Ruiz

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String CHARACTER_REPRESENTING_CRICKETS
      Cricket represented by String C, used for Board lists to create String Board List
      static java.lang.String CHARACTER_REPRESENTING_EMPTYSPACE
      EmptySpaces represented by String ., used for Board lists to create String Board List
      static java.lang.String CHARACTER_REPRESENTING_GRASSHOPPERS
      Grasshoppers represented by String G, used for Board lists to create String Board List
      static int CRICKET_MOVE_DIRECTION
      Direction of the cricket, 1 signifies moving forward position = position + 1
      static int GRASSHOPPER_MOVE_DIRECTION
      Direction of the Grasshopper, -1 signifies moving forward position = position - 1
      static int NUMBER_REPRESENTING_CRICKETS
      Cricket represented by number 1, used for Board lists
      static int NUMBER_REPRESENTING_EMPTYSPACE
      Empty Spaces represented by number 0, used for Board lists
      static int NUMBER_REPRESENTING_GRASSHOPPERS
      Grasshopper represented by number 1, used for Board lists
      static int OPEN_SPACES_MAX
      Max number of open spaces allowed, used for main method
      static int PLAYER_LIMIT_MAX
      Max number of players allowed, used for main method

        public static int promptNumberReadLine(java.util.Scanner scanner,
                                       java.lang.String prompt,

        promptNumberReadLine will 3 parameters, return int. Will print out prompt, Use scanner to read input and check if number is 1. integer 2. Within 1 and Max
        Parameters:
        scanner - the Scanner to use for input
        prompt - String that will be printed out
        the - maximum allowed value
        Returns:
        a validated integer input from the user

      • createBoard

        public static int[] createBoard(int piecesPerPlayer,
                                int spacesInMiddle)
        Create Board process the amount of playerPieces and amount of Spaces and returns a array containing playerPieces of both sides (Grasshoppers and Crickets) and the spaces in between the two side Example Output: [1, 1, 1, 0, 0, 0, 2, 2, 2]
        Parameters:
        piecesPerPlayer - number for the amount of players on both sides
        spacesInMiddle - amount of spaces in middle, also a number
        Returns:
        returns int[] array of the board with both sides of players (Grasshoppers and Crickets) and the spacing in between

        public static java.lang.String boardToString(int[] board)
        Converts given int[] array into a String
        Parameters:
        board - int[] array representing open spaces, players in 0, 1, 2
        Returns:
        will return a String of the board

      • canMove

        public static boolean canMove(int[] board,
                              int player)
        Will check if player has any available positions, will return false in no positions are available
        Parameters:
        board - int[] array that will be checked for available positions
        player - (int) player that needs to be checked for available positions
        Returns:
        returns boolean, True if position is available, false if no more positions

      • move

        public static boolean move(int[] board,
                           int player,
                           int position)
        Will move the position of the player by rewriting board array
        Parameters:
        board - int[] array of player board that will be rewritten for move
        player - player that will be moved, also used to determine direction
        position - positions that the player wants to move from.
        Returns:
        true if move was successful, false if cannot move

      • initializeGame

        public static int[] initializeGame(java.util.Scanner scanner)
        Will begun initializing the game, asking for needed prompts and then creating board based on prompts
        Parameters:
        scanner - the Scanner to use for input
        Returns:
        returns array of called method createBoard (will create a board based on input variables)

      • switchPlayer

        public static int switchPlayer(int playerTurn)
        switches playerTurn to other player
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        playerturn after it has been swapped

      • playTurn

        public static void playTurn(java.util.Scanner ScannerSystem,
                            int[] currentIntBoard,
                            int playerTurn)
        Method will play the turn, asking for requested move, checking if move is possible and then updating board once move has been done.
        Parameters:
        ScannerSystem - the Scanner to use for input
        currentIntBoard - array of the current board
        playerTurn - integer representing whose turn it is
